title.narrative: Tibet Basic Education Programme Phase 5

description.narrative: The overall objective of Save the Children's project in Tibet is to provide teacher training to improve the capacity of the Tibetan population to develop and influence their own future as a minority group in China.

title.narrative: 3. To strengthen the capacity of local partners at prefecture and county level to monitor the quality of classroom teaching supported by the 12-step model (Tibet)
3. To strengthen the capacity of local partners at prefecture and county level to monitor the quality of classroom teaching supported by the 12-step model (Tibet)

target.value: By the end of 2016. partners at PEBs and CEBs are assessing the quality of teaching by using the jointly developed monitoring tools. and by the end of 2016. the prefecture education bureaus have established a strong and stable trainer group.

actual.value: By the end of 2016. 80% of CEBs are using the tools to share lesson learned among teachers by following the agreed procedures; CEB established trainer group with 70 trainers/supervisors who are capable to deliver teacher training; and trainers are capable of organizing the participatory training workshops and of facilitating training sessions on learner-centred teaching/learning methods.

title.narrative: 4. To transfer the learning and experience on action research of Tibet to other regions in China (Yunnan)
4. To transfer the learning and experience on action research of Tibet to other regions in China (Yunnan)

target.value: AR teams in pilot schools were established; AR training was delivered to Yunnan SC staffs and local partners; Students falling behind have improved in their identified problems; Study tour to Tibet was conducted; Updated AR Guide was produced and shared with all projects schools.

actual.value: Four AR teams in pilot schools conducted at least two round each semester; the teachers realized the AR concept and process; research staffs involved are able to support and monitor the AR work of pilot schools; 3 SC staff carried out the project activities and supported the pilot schools; all focal students have improved in their identified problems. 12 out of 58 focal students made great progress in academic performance; besides Tibet. SC also conducted a study tour to Beijing. the four AR teams learnt useful and meaningful experiences; and considering the local situation. an improved and updated AR Guide was produced. which was more practical and easier to promote in Yunnan.

title.narrative: 1.1 Three action research teams have been established (1 in each county) and they are working as teams (an AR team consists of research staff from LMEB (1), CEB (1-2), from the school (1), 2 teachers and 1-2 SC staff)

1.1 Three action research teams have been established (1 in each county) and they are working as teams (an AR team consists of research staff from LMEB (1), CEB (1-2), from the school (1), 2 teachers and 1-2 SC staff)

actual.value: One more AR team was established in 2014 in Chuschur County's Nyitang IPS. The team welcomed representatives from the other neighbouring schools to join the research process as the three schools were organised in one cluster. Meanwhile. the SC team countinously provided training and follow-up support to AR pilot schools in Tagtse and Medro Gongar counties and helped focal teachers in planning and carrying out the actions. All AR teams experienced a complete cycle of AR and produced their own case study reports. The team conducted an assessment through discussion with children. interview with partners and research staff. and handed out questionnaires for focal teachers. The key purpose of this assessment was to understand the partners' capacity in AR work and the feasibility of sustaining the AR work by partners.

title.narrative: 4.3 Lead the transfer of TBEP action research experience to Save the Children Yunnan's project staff and partners
4.3 Lead the transfer of TBEP action research experience to Save the Children Yunnan's project staff and partners

actual.value: The team conducted the first round of training workshop on AR (1-3 steps) in May for 43 teachers from six AR pilot schools. including two schools from Malipo county. The Tibet team provided constant support when the six AR pilot schools implemented their AR action plans via online communication with AR members. providing comments and suggestions for six AR teams to improve the analysis and specific methods for identified pupils learning difficulties. The Tibet team travelled to Malipo County. and conducted three day AR training for 20 teachers followed by a two day visit to two AR pilot schools. The team conducted the second round of AR training workshop for 24 participants from Bestseller’s project schools. focusing on step 4 to 7 of AR. Two rounds of experience sharing meetings were conducted after teachers carried out AR activities according to their work plan and provided recommendations for further improvements.
